items.title: Zelenskyy to travel to US for Trump meeting amid push for Ukraine deal
items.standfirst: Meeting on Sunday will follow flurry of US, Russian and Ukrainian talks, but Putin has shown little sign of softeningVolodymyr Zelenskyy is to travel to the US for a planned meeting with Donald Trump on Sunday, as Washington continues to push for a possible peace deal between Kyiv and Moscow.The Ukrainian president said the visit would take place at a location in Florida – widely expected to be Trump’s Mar-a-Lago resort – in what would be the latest development in a diplomatic push that began in November with the circulation of a 28-point US plan shaped with input from Russian officials. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump announces strikes in Nigeria; Zelenskyy signals potential Trump meeting on Russia war
items.standfirst: President Trump announced strikes against ISIS targets in Nigeria. Also, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that a potential meeting with Mr. Trump is in the works. CBS News' Olivia Rinaldi reports.
items.content: President Trump announced strikes against ISIS targets in Nigeria. Also, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced that a potential meeting with Mr. Trump is in the works. CBS News' Olivia Rinaldi reports.

items.title: Nigeria signals more strikes likely in "join" US operations
items.standfirst: Nigeria has indicated that further strikes against jihadist groups may follow a joint operation with the United States that targeted Islamic State militants in the country’s northwest on Thursday. The foreign minister said Nigeria provided the intelligence for the attack and described cooperation with Washington as ongoing. The U.S. military reported multiple deaths in the Christmas Day bombing, as President Donald Trump reiterated claims that militant groups in Nigeria are targeting “innocent Christians.” For analysis, we hear from Oluwole Ojewale, Coordinator for West and Central Africa at the Institute for Security Studies.
items.content: Nigeria has indicated that further strikes against jihadist groups may follow a joint operation with the United States that targeted Islamic State militants in the country’s northwest on Thursday. The foreign minister said Nigeria provided the intelligence for the attack and described cooperation with Washington as ongoing. The U.S. military reported multiple deaths in the Christmas Day bombing, as President Donald Trump reiterated claims that militant groups in Nigeria are targeting “innocent Christians.” For analysis, we hear from Oluwole Ojewale, Coordinator for West and Central Africa at the Institute for Security Studies.

items.title: Trump supporters hail US strikes in Nigeria as ‘amazing Christmas present’
items.standfirst: Some even celebrated ‘mass killing’ and the president’s ‘resolve’ in attacking Islamic State targets The US’s Christmas Day strikes against Islamic State targets in Nigeria have been met with praise by Donald Trump supporters who for months had been agitating for the president to respond forcefully to the killings of Christians in the country.“I can’t think of a better way to celebrate Christmas than by avenging the death of Christians through the justified mass killing of Islamic terrorists,” the far-right political activist Laura Loomer posted on X. “You’ve got to love it! Death to all Islamic terrorists! Thank you.” Continue reading...
items.content: Some even celebrated ‘mass killing’ and the president’s ‘resolve’ in attacking Islamic State targets The US’s Christmas Day strikes against Islamic State targets in Nigeria have been met with praise by Donald Trump supporters who for months had been agitating for the president to respond forcefully to the killings of Christians in the country.“I can’t think of a better way to celebrate Christmas than by avenging the death of Christians through the justified mass killing of Islamic terrorists,” the far-right political activist Laura Loomer posted on X. “You’ve got to love it! Death to all Islamic terrorists! Thank you.” Continue reading...

items.title: Donald Trump to meet Zelensky on Sunday
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would meet US President Donald Trump in Florida over the weekend to discuss territory and security guarantees, a day after meeting White House negotiators to discuss ways to end the war in Ukraine. Laurent Berstecher reports.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would meet US President Donald Trump in Florida over the weekend to discuss territory and security guarantees, a day after meeting White House negotiators to discuss ways to end the war in Ukraine. Laurent Berstecher reports.

items.title: Trump announces "powerful and deadly" strikes in Nigeria targeting ISIS
items.standfirst: President Trump announced strikes in Nigeria against Islamic State forces on Christmas Day. CBS News' Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: President Trump announced strikes in Nigeria against Islamic State forces on Christmas Day. CBS News' Willie James Inman reports.

items.title: US warns of more Nigeria strikes as Abuja talks of ‘joint ongoing operations’
items.standfirst: Pete Hegseth says ‘more to come’ as Nigerian minister confirms his country provided intelligence for first waveThe US defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, has warned of new strikes against Islamic State targets in north-western Nigeria, hours after the US military took action against militant camps in what Donald Trump has characterised as efforts to stop the killing of Christians.Hegseth wrote on X: “The president was clear last month: the killing of innocent Christians in Nigeria (and elsewhere) must end. The [Pentagon] is always ready, so ISIS found out tonight – on Christmas. More to come … Grateful for Nigerian government support & cooperation. Merry Christmas!” Continue reading...
items.content: Pete Hegseth says ‘more to come’ as Nigerian minister confirms his country provided intelligence for first waveThe US defence secretary, Pete Hegseth, has warned of new strikes against Islamic State targets in north-western Nigeria, hours after the US military took action against militant camps in what Donald Trump has characterised as efforts to stop the killing of Christians.Hegseth wrote on X: “The president was clear last month: the killing of innocent Christians in Nigeria (and elsewhere) must end. The [Pentagon] is always ready, so ISIS found out tonight – on Christmas. More to come … Grateful for Nigerian government support & cooperation. Merry Christmas!” Continue reading...

items.title: US cooperation with Nigerian government targets Islamic State group
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Thursday that the US had launched "precision hits on terrorist targets in Nigeria by air strikes". The claim came in a Christmas night social media post that offered few details, though US Africa Command later confirmed the strikes were conducted at the request of Nigerian authorities who said multiple Islamic State group militants were killed. Gabriel Nadler reports.
items.content: President Donald Trump said Thursday that the US had launched "precision hits on terrorist targets in Nigeria by air strikes". The claim came in a Christmas night social media post that offered few details, though US Africa Command later confirmed the strikes were conducted at the request of Nigerian authorities who said multiple Islamic State group militants were killed. Gabriel Nadler reports.

items.content: Donald Trump said President Zelenskyy "doesn't have anything until I approve it", ahead of a meeting with the Ukrainian leader on Sunday.

items.title: U.S. strikes ISIS in Nigeria. And, holiday shopping was higher than expected

items.content: The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than expected this year.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

items.title: Trump announces strikes in Nigeria against Islamic State group targets
items.standfirst: The US carried out a strike against Islamic State group militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, US President Donald Trump and the US military said on Thursday, claiming the group had been targeting Christians in the region. FRANCE 24 correspondent Chinwe Ossundu reports the latest from Nigeria.
items.content: The US carried out a strike against Islamic State group militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, US President Donald Trump and the US military said on Thursday, claiming the group had been targeting Christians in the region. FRANCE 24 correspondent Chinwe Ossundu reports the latest from Nigeria.

items.title: U.S. says it struck ISIS in Nigeria after Trump warns of attacks on Christians
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he ordered “numerous” strikes on Islamic State terrorists in Nigeria he accused of killing Christians.“The United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!” Trump said in a post on Truth Social
items.content: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he ordered “numerous” strikes on Islamic State terrorists in Nigeria he accused of killing Christians.“The United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!” Trump said in a post on Truth Social

items.standfirst: Defence minister instructs military to respond with force in West Bank, where he said attacker was fromA Palestinian motorist ran over a man and stabbed a woman in northern Israel, killing both, Israeli emergency services say.The assailant, from the occupied West Bank, was shot and wounded by a civilian at the scene on Friday and taken to hospital, Israeli police said. Continue reading...

items.content: The attack began Friday afternoon in the northern city of Beit Shean, where the Palestinian man crashed his vehicle into people, killing one man and injuring a teenage boy.

items.content: Attack comes a day after Israeli army reservist in civilian clothes rammed into Palestinian man praying on roadside.

items.title: Two killed in northern Israel by Palestinian stabbing, car ramming attack
items.standfirst: At least two people died in a stabbing and car ramming attack in northern Israel on Friday, Israeli police said. Both victims died from their injuries and the alleged attacker, a resident of the occupied West Bank, was injured and hospitalised. Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz quickly ordered military retaliation on the suspect's hometown.
items.content: At least two people died in a stabbing and car ramming attack in northern Israel on Friday, Israeli police said. Both victims died from their injuries and the alleged attacker, a resident of the occupied West Bank, was injured and hospitalised. Israeli Defense Minister Israel Katz quickly ordered military retaliation on the suspect's hometown.

items.title: Blast at Syrian mosque during Friday prayers leaves at least eight dead
items.standfirst: The explosion in Homs targeted a predominantly Alawite area, a sect that has faced crackdowns and violence since the fall of former-President Bashar al-Assad.
items.content: The explosion in Homs targeted a predominantly Alawite area, a sect that has faced crackdowns and violence since the fall of former-President Bashar al-Assad.

items.title: Islamist militant group claims deadly bombing of Alawite mosque in Syria's Homs
items.standfirst: At least eight people were killed and 18 wounded in a blast that struck a mosque in an Alawite neighbourhood of Homs province in Syria on Friday, state media reported. Islamist militant group Saraya Ansar al-Sunna claimed responsibility for the attack. Formed after former president Bashar al-Assad’s ouster, the group in June claimed an attack on a Damascus church.
items.content: At least eight people were killed and 18 wounded in a blast that struck a mosque in an Alawite neighbourhood of Homs province in Syria on Friday, state media reported. Islamist militant group Saraya Ansar al-Sunna claimed responsibility for the attack. Formed after former president Bashar al-Assad’s ouster, the group in June claimed an attack on a Damascus church.

clusters.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal
clusters.neutral_headline: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal

items.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal
items.standfirst: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB.Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...
items.content: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB.Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...

items.title: Ex-Malaysia PM Najib Razak given 15-year jail term over state funds scandal
items.standfirst: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.
items.content: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

items.title: Former Malaysia PM Najib sentenced to 15 more years in landmark 1MDB corruption case
items.standfirst: Former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak, already serving a prison term for an earlier conviction linked to the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) sovereign wealth fund, on Friday was sentenced to a further 15 years in prison and ordered to pay 13.5 billion ringgit ($3.3 billion) in fines and asset recovery. The High Court found him guilty of abuse of power and money laundering in a case that exposed one of the world’s largest financial scandals.
items.content: Former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak, already serving a prison term for an earlier conviction linked to the 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) sovereign wealth fund, on Friday was sentenced to a further 15 years in prison and ordered to pay 13.5 billion ringgit ($3.3 billion) in fines and asset recovery. The High Court found him guilty of abuse of power and money laundering in a case that exposed one of the world’s largest financial scandals.

items.title: Ellison, Paramount Put Pressure on WBD for a Deal
items.standfirst: Warner Bros. Discovery shares slid early Friday in premarket trading after a report from the New York Post said that Paramount Skydance could walk away from its $30-per-share cash bid and instead litigate against the company’s board for how it handled the process. But with Larry Ellison personally backing the Paramount bid, the pressure is still on. Bloomberg's Chris Palmeri reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Warner Bros. Discovery shares slid early Friday in premarket trading after a report from the New York Post said that Paramount Skydance could walk away from its $30-per-share cash bid and instead litigate against the company’s board for how it handled the process. But with Larry Ellison personally backing the Paramount bid, the pressure is still on. Bloomberg's Chris Palmeri reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: China imposes sanctions on US defence firms over Taiwan arms deal
items.standfirst: $10bn Trump-approved sale to Taipei triggers Beijing sanctions against firms such as Boeing and Northrop GrummanChina’s foreign ministry has hit US defence companies including Boeing with sanctions after Donald Trump approved a large package of arms sales to Taiwan.The ministry said on Friday that the measures – against 10 individuals and 20 US firms including Boeing’s production hub at St Louis in Missouri – would freeze any assets the companies and individuals hold in China and bar domestic organisations and individuals from doing business with them. Continue reading...
items.content: $10bn Trump-approved sale to Taipei triggers Beijing sanctions against firms such as Boeing and Northrop GrummanChina’s foreign ministry has hit US defence companies including Boeing with sanctions after Donald Trump approved a large package of arms sales to Taiwan.The ministry said on Friday that the measures – against 10 individuals and 20 US firms including Boeing’s production hub at St Louis in Missouri – would freeze any assets the companies and individuals hold in China and bar domestic organisations and individuals from doing business with them. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Family of man missing at sea pay tribute
clusters.neutral_headline: Family pays tribute to one of two men missing after Christmas Day swim

items.title: Family of man missing at sea pay tribute
items.standfirst: The family of Matthew Upham have named him as one of the swimmers who went missing on Christmas Day.
items.content: The family of Matthew Upham have named him as one of the swimmers who went missing on Christmas Day.

items.title: Family pays tribute to one of two men missing after Christmas Day swim
items.standfirst: Coastguard calls off search for Matthew Upham and second man who went missing off Budleigh Salterton in DevonTributes have been paid to one of two men who went missing during a Christmas Day swim.The family of Matthew Upham issued a tribute to him on the Instagram account of his antiques business, saying he was “deeply loved and forever missed”. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: For half a century, psychedelics largely belonged to the cultural left: anti-war, anti-capitalist, suspicious of the church and state. Now, one of the most politically consequential psychedelic drugs in the US – ibogaine – is being championed by evangelical Christians, Republican governors,…
items.content: For half a century, psychedelics largely belonged to the cultural left: anti-war, anti-capitalist, suspicious of the church and state. Now, one of the most politically consequential psychedelic drugs in the US – ibogaine – is being championed by evangelical Christians, Republican governors,…

items.title: Conservative and Christian? US right champions psychedelic drugs
items.standfirst: Texas governor among those to call for expanded access to ibogaine, said to help with treating veterans with PTSDFor half a century, psychedelics largely belonged to the cultural left: anti-war, anti-capitalist, suspicious of the church and state. Now, one of the most politically consequential psychedelic drugs in the US – ibogaine – is being championed by evangelical Christians, Republican governors, military veterans, and big tech billionaires.Many of them see ibogaine, an intense psychedelic derived from a central African rootbark, as a divine technology. In fact, some pointedly do not refer to it as a psychedelic, given the apparent baggage of the term in some circles. Continue reading...
items.content: Texas governor among those to call for expanded access to ibogaine, said to help with treating veterans with PTSDFor half a century, psychedelics largely belonged to the cultural left: anti-war, anti-capitalist, suspicious of the church and state. Now, one of the most politically consequential psychedelic drugs in the US – ibogaine – is being championed by evangelical Christians, Republican governors, military veterans, and big tech billionaires.Many of them see ibogaine, an intense psychedelic derived from a central African rootbark, as a divine technology. In fact, some pointedly do not refer to it as a psychedelic, given the apparent baggage of the term in some circles. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state

items.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
items.standfirst: Diplomatic breakthrough comes more than three decades after declaration of independence from SomaliaIsrael has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...
items.content: Diplomatic breakthrough comes more than three decades after declaration of independence from SomaliaIsrael has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland
items.standfirst: Breakaway region of Somalia achieves diplomatic breakthrough after more than 30 years without international recognition.
items.content: Breakaway region of Somalia achieves diplomatic breakthrough after more than 30 years without international recognition.

clusters.title: Southern Yemeni separatists accuse Saudi Arabia of air strikes in eastern provinces
clusters.neutral_headline: Southern separatists in Yemen report Saudi airstrikes near positions

items.title: Southern Yemeni separatists accuse Saudi Arabia of air strikes in eastern provinces
items.standfirst: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged. While vowing they will not be deterred, the STC said it remains open to coordination with the kingdom, underscoring strains within the Saudi-led coalition.
items.content: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged. While vowing they will not be deterred, the STC said it remains open to coordination with the kingdom, underscoring strains within the Saudi-led coalition.

items.title: Southern separatists in Yemen report Saudi airstrikes near positions
items.standfirst: Alleged strikes close to UAE-backed forces follow Riyadh’s call for STC to withdraw from newly seized provincesA separatist group in southern Yemen that this month seized two oil-rich provinces has claimed that Saudi Arabia has fired warning airstrikes directed at its forces.Videos issued on Friday by media linked to the United Arab Emirates-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC) showed airstrikes that it said were close to its positions in Wadi Nahab, Hadramaut province. Continue reading...
items.content: Alleged strikes close to UAE-backed forces follow Riyadh’s call for STC to withdraw from newly seized provincesA separatist group in southern Yemen that this month seized two oil-rich provinces has claimed that Saudi Arabia has fired warning airstrikes directed at its forces.Videos issued on Friday by media linked to the United Arab Emirates-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC) showed airstrikes that it said were close to its positions in Wadi Nahab, Hadramaut province. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Bangladesh's PM front-runner Tarique Rahman returns after 17 years
clusters.neutral_headline: Front-runner to be Bangladesh PM returns after 17 years in exile

items.title: Bangladesh's PM front-runner Tarique Rahman returns after 17 years
items.standfirst: Hundreds of thousands of BNP supporters gathered in Dhaka to welcome the party's acting chief Tarique Rahman, who returned to Bangladesh after 17 years in exile. In his first remarks after returning, Rahman called for communal harmony and promised to unveil a plan for Bangladesh. Charlotte Lam reports.
items.content: Hundreds of thousands of BNP supporters gathered in Dhaka to welcome the party's acting chief Tarique Rahman, who returned to Bangladesh after 17 years in exile. In his first remarks after returning, Rahman called for communal harmony and promised to unveil a plan for Bangladesh. Charlotte Lam reports.

items.title: Front-runner to be Bangladesh PM returns after 17 years in exile
items.standfirst: Tarique Rahman, who has lived in London since 2008, arrives weeks before pivotal elections are held.
items.content: Tarique Rahman, who has lived in London since 2008, arrives weeks before pivotal elections are held.
